trans-unit.source: CNCF Annual Report 2022 - Building for the road ahead
trans-unit.target: CNCF Annual Report 2022 - Building for the road ahead

trans-unit.source: Welcome! It's been a year to remember
trans-unit.target: Welcome! It's been a year to remember

source.g: When I look back on 2022, it's with a deep sense of pride for what we have overcome and achieved together. Despite the collective challenges we've faced, and continue to tackle, the cloud native ecosystem has soared. We've welcomed new industries, projects, and swelled our community to 7.1 million cloud native developers, surpassing the population of Denmark!

target.g: When I look back on 2022, it's with a deep sense of pride for what we have overcome and achieved together. Despite the collective challenges we've faced, and continue to tackle, the cloud native ecosystem has soared. We've welcomed new industries, projects, and swelled our community to 7.1 million cloud native developers, surpassing the population of Denmark!

trans-unit.source: Cloud native has crossed the chasm and more organizations than ever before are becoming software companies. This was reflected at our KubeCon + CloudNativeCon events, where businesses like Mercedes Benz and Boeing headlined keynotes alongside well-known tech brands.
trans-unit.target: Cloud native has crossed the chasm and more organizations than ever before are becoming software companies. This was reflected at our KubeCon + CloudNativeCon events, where businesses like Mercedes Benz and Boeing headlined keynotes alongside well-known tech brands.

trans-unit.source: Of course, none of this would be possible without our truly global, welcoming community of doers - #TeamCloudNative. I want to personally thank each and every one of you, all 178,000, for your commitment and contributions, no matter how big or small, we're on this journey together.
trans-unit.target: Of course, none of this would be possible without our truly global, welcoming community of doers - #TeamCloudNative. I want to personally thank each and every one of you, all 178,000, for your commitment and contributions, no matter how big or small, we're on this journey together.

trans-unit.source: I hope you enjoy reading about our milestones and reflecting back on the impressive progress we've achieved together this year.
trans-unit.target: I hope you enjoy reading about our milestones and reflecting back on the impressive progress we've achieved together this year.

trans-unit.source: The (KubeCon + CloudNativeCon) hallway track conversations are shifting towards adjusting to the enterprise. We had Ford on the show, Mass Mutual, ING and Home Depot. We are seeing all of these big companies that we know and love become software companies right before our eyes.
trans-unit.target: The (KubeCon + CloudNativeCon) hallway track conversations are shifting towards adjusting to the enterprise. We had Ford on the show, Mass Mutual, ING and Home Depot. We are seeing all of these big companies that we know and love become software companies right before our eyes.

trans-unit.source: CNCF is an open source software foundation dedicated to making cloud native computing ubiquitous. Since we were founded in 2015, we've pioneered cloud native technologies - hosting and growing some of the world's most successful open source projects including Kubernetes, Prometheus, Envoy, ContainerD, and many others.Today we are a powerhouse for visionary projects and people, hosting 157 projects with over 178,000 contributors representing 189 countries, and there are no signs of this growth slowing down.
trans-unit.target: CNCF is an open source software foundation dedicated to making cloud native computing ubiquitous. Since we were founded in 2015, we've pioneered cloud native technologies - hosting and growing some of the world's most successful open source projects including Kubernetes, Prometheus, Envoy, ContainerD, and many others.Today we are a powerhouse for visionary projects and people, hosting 157 projects with over 178,000 contributors representing 189 countries, and there are no signs of this growth slowing down.

trans-unit.source: Chart showing upward trend of Contributors growth
trans-unit.target: Chart showing upward trend of Contributors growth

trans-unit.source: Chart showing upward trend of Members, End User and Project growth
trans-unit.target: Chart showing upward trend of Members, End User and Project growth

trans-unit.source: The CNCF ecosystem continues to grow across vendor and end user memberships, making CNCF one of the most successful open source foundations ever. In fact, we welcomed more than 220 new members to CNCF this year.Today, CNCF has over 850 participating organizations, including the world's largest public and private cloud companies, along with the world's most innovative software companies and end user organizations. Investment from these leading organizations signifies a strong dedication to the advancement and sustainability of cloud native computing for years to come.
trans-unit.target: The CNCF ecosystem continues to grow across vendor and end user memberships, making CNCF one of the most successful open source foundations ever. In fact, we welcomed more than 220 new members to CNCF this year.Today, CNCF has over 850 participating organizations, including the world's largest public and private cloud companies, along with the world's most innovative software companies and end user organizations. Investment from these leading organizations signifies a strong dedication to the advancement and sustainability of cloud native computing for years to come.

trans-unit.source: 220+ new members 19 new members from China
trans-unit.target: 220+ new members 19 new members from China

trans-unit.source: Chart showing CNCF Membership growth with a rising trend line.
trans-unit.target: Chart showing CNCF Membership growth with a rising trend line.

trans-unit.source: A 15% increase of membership growth compared to 2021
trans-unit.target: A 15% increase of membership growth compared to 2021

trans-unit.source: Organizations that sell cloud native technologies built on, or integrated with, CNCF projects are eligible to join as general members.
trans-unit.target: Organizations that sell cloud native technologies built on, or integrated with, CNCF projects are eligible to join as general members.

trans-unit.source: Audience at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America 2022
trans-unit.target: Audience at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America 2022

trans-unit.source: The cloud native ecosystem is getting bigger and better; end users' trust in open source is steering it forward!
trans-unit.target: The cloud native ecosystem is getting bigger and better; end users' trust in open source is steering it forward!

trans-unit.source: End Users within the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) are member companies that use cloud native technologies internally, do not sell any cloud native services externally, and aren't vendors, consultancies, training partners, or telecommunications companies.Individuals within end user companies are passionate about solving problems using cloud native architectures and providing teams with self-service solutions which create a more inclusive, iterative process.
trans-unit.target: End Users within the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) are member companies that use cloud native technologies internally, do not sell any cloud native services externally, and aren't vendors, consultancies, training partners, or telecommunications companies.Individuals within end user companies are passionate about solving problems using cloud native architectures and providing teams with self-service solutions which create a more inclusive, iterative process.

trans-unit.source: 100% would recommend CNCF to other companies ( 2022 End User survey )
trans-unit.target: 100% would recommend CNCF to other companies ( 2022 End User survey )

trans-unit.source: We were thrilled to grant Mercedes-Benz and Intuit our Top End User Awards this year, in recognition of their notable contributions to the cloud native ecosystem.
trans-unit.target: We were thrilled to grant Mercedes-Benz and Intuit our Top End User Awards this year, in recognition of their notable contributions to the cloud native ecosystem.

trans-unit.source: CNCF has become an embodiment of the spirit of open source, the spirit of freedom and choice, and at the same time has become synonymous with high quality cloud software. Every time we have requirements to build software for our Cloud Infrastructure, the first thing we do is go to the CNCF landscape and evaluate the choices available.
trans-unit.target: CNCF has become an embodiment of the spirit of open source, the spirit of freedom and choice, and at the same time has become synonymous with high quality cloud software. Every time we have requirements to build software for our Cloud Infrastructure, the first thing we do is go to the CNCF landscape and evaluate the choices available.

trans-unit.source: As teams adopt cloud native strategies, it's clear that there is no "one size fits all" solution to the challenges organizations face. That's why, in 2022, CNCF launched the CTO Summit. This Chatham House-governed summit convenes CTOs from end user enterprises to discuss how organizations can leverage people, processes, and technologies to improve resiliency in cloud native computing.
trans-unit.target: As teams adopt cloud native strategies, it's clear that there is no "one size fits all" solution to the challenges organizations face. That's why, in 2022, CNCF launched the CTO Summit. This Chatham House-governed summit convenes CTOs from end user enterprises to discuss how organizations can leverage people, processes, and technologies to improve resiliency in cloud native computing.

trans-unit.source: We've started this CTO Summit where end users, like Boeing, Fidelity, Intuit, and many others can come together and have a private conversation about how they are handling technical challenges in their organizations. Often the most impactful lessons come from our peers.
trans-unit.target: We've started this CTO Summit where end users, like Boeing, Fidelity, Intuit, and many others can come together and have a private conversation about how they are handling technical challenges in their organizations. Often the most impactful lessons come from our peers.

trans-unit.source: CTO Summit Report - KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Europe 2022
trans-unit.target: CTO Summit Report - KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Europe 2022

trans-unit.source: Coming January 2023KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America CTO Summit Report
trans-unit.target: Coming January 2023KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America CTO Summit Report

trans-unit.source: In May we launched the redesigned and rebuilt CNCF.io. The site increases focus on representing the community in more effective, vibrant, and interactive ways. It provides additional areas to share CNCF and End User content, events, news, and blog articles. It also features improved UX and navigation, thanks to the dynamic mega menu and simplified navigation throughout. Importantly, we're doubling down on accessibility - following the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 and aiming for Level AA accessibility on CNCF.io. Throughout the year we rolled out the new design to CNCF subsites, including Contributors, as well as applying WCAG guidelines to all of our sites.
trans-unit.target: In May we launched the redesigned and rebuilt CNCF.io. The site increases focus on representing the community in more effective, vibrant, and interactive ways. It provides additional areas to share CNCF and End User content, events, news, and blog articles. It also features improved UX and navigation, thanks to the dynamic mega menu and simplified navigation throughout. Importantly, we're doubling down on accessibility - following the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 and aiming for Level AA accessibility on CNCF.io. Throughout the year we rolled out the new design to CNCF subsites, including Contributors, as well as applying WCAG guidelines to all of our sites.

trans-unit.source: The CNCF.io website on various websites
trans-unit.target: The CNCF.io website on various websites

trans-unit.source: At the heart of CNCF is our welcoming community of doers, working together to make cloud native ubiquitous. This year we launched the Humans of Cloud Native project to tell the stories of amazing individuals and their contributions that make team cloud native such a vibrant, exciting and diverse space.
trans-unit.target: At the heart of CNCF is our welcoming community of doers, working together to make cloud native ubiquitous. This year we launched the Humans of Cloud Native project to tell the stories of amazing individuals and their contributions that make team cloud native such a vibrant, exciting and diverse space.

trans-unit.source: Attendees at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America 2022
trans-unit.target: Attendees at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America 2022

trans-unit.source: Join our amazing set of humans!
trans-unit.target: Join our amazing set of humans!

trans-unit.source: Do you know somebody doing incredible things in the cloud native ecosystem? Nominate them for the Humans of Cloud Native
trans-unit.target: Do you know somebody doing incredible things in the cloud native ecosystem? Nominate them for the Humans of Cloud Native

trans-unit.source: Having seen what KubeCon has to offer, I'm sorry I missed every previous KubeCon since (they began in) 2015. For a veteran cloud blogger, this conference is a peek into the future of distributed development.
trans-unit.target: Having seen what KubeCon has to offer, I'm sorry I missed every previous KubeCon since (they began in) 2015. For a veteran cloud blogger, this conference is a peek into the future of distributed development.

trans-unit.source: Some of the crowd at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America 2022
trans-unit.target: Some of the crowd at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America 2022

trans-unit.source: This year we welcomed our community safely back to in-person events. At the same time, CNCF continued to double down on digital, offering virtual access to all our major events to provide opportunities for collaboration, learning, and networking from every corner of the globe.
trans-unit.target: This year we welcomed our community safely back to in-person events. At the same time, CNCF continued to double down on digital, offering virtual access to all our major events to provide opportunities for collaboration, learning, and networking from every corner of the globe.

trans-unit.source: In response to the cloud native community's evolving needs in different regions, CNCF strengthened the Kubernetes Community Days (KCD) program this year. KCDs are community-organized events that gather adopters and technologists to learn, collaborate, and network, with a goal of furthering the adoption and improvement of Kubernetes and cloud native technologies around the world.
trans-unit.target: In response to the cloud native community's evolving needs in different regions, CNCF strengthened the Kubernetes Community Days (KCD) program this year. KCDs are community-organized events that gather adopters and technologists to learn, collaborate, and network, with a goal of furthering the adoption and improvement of Kubernetes and cloud native technologies around the world.

trans-unit.source: (English, Slavic, Chinese, Spanish, Italian, and Indonesian)
trans-unit.target: (English, Slavic, Chinese, Spanish, Italian, and Indonesian)

trans-unit.source: We also implemented additional measures to help support our KCD communities and organizers to ensure program success:
trans-unit.target: We also implemented additional measures to help support our KCD communities and organizers to ensure program success:

trans-unit.source: Our organizer terms and conditions in the KCD GitHub repository were updated to include new provisions in addition to the pre-existing requirement of organizers to take the Inclusive Open Source Community Orientation. The new terms are as follows:
trans-unit.target: Our organizer terms and conditions in the KCD GitHub repository were updated to include new provisions in addition to the pre-existing requirement of organizers to take the Inclusive Open Source Community Orientation. The new terms are as follows:

trans-unit.source: Agree to ensure the final program schedule is diverse (e.g., not all speakers of one gender, one culture, or age)
trans-unit.target: Agree to ensure the final program schedule is diverse (e.g., not all speakers of one gender, one culture, or age)

trans-unit.source: To assure a diverse lineup, you must send a copy of your program to kcd@cncf.io for review and approval before publication.
trans-unit.target: To assure a diverse lineup, you must send a copy of your program to kcd@cncf.io for review and approval before publication.

trans-unit.source: Organizers will ensure the speaker lineup is diverse in terms of companies represented.
trans-unit.target: Organizers will ensure the speaker lineup is diverse in terms of companies represented.

trans-unit.source: We encourage KCD organizers to consider and include talks that are non-technical and non-code contributions.
trans-unit.target: We encourage KCD organizers to consider and include talks that are non-technical and non-code contributions.

trans-unit.source: In July, we started hosting a one-hour monthly organizer meeting with topics to help guide organizers during their planning process. August's topic was “How to Curate a Diverse Lineup.” This meeting featured resources and recommendations for organizers on how to build and recruit diversity within their schedules. We provide slides, as well as recording the session.
trans-unit.target: In July, we started hosting a one-hour monthly organizer meeting with topics to help guide organizers during their planning process. August's topic was “How to Curate a Diverse Lineup.” This meeting featured resources and recommendations for organizers on how to build and recruit diversity within their schedules. We provide slides, as well as recording the session.

trans-unit.source: When we returned to having in-person events, both the number and severity of Code of Conduct incidents increased. Our increased focus on Code of Conduct highlighted the need to modernize our processes, which had previously been entirely foundation-managed, by including community representation and providing greater transparency. As a result, this year:
trans-unit.target: When we returned to having in-person events, both the number and severity of Code of Conduct incidents increased. Our increased focus on Code of Conduct highlighted the need to modernize our processes, which had previously been entirely foundation-managed, by including community representation and providing greater transparency. As a result, this year:

trans-unit.source: We launched a Code of Conduct Working Group to develop an updated structure and set of procedures. Their work is ongoing, and anyone in the community is welcome to participate and contribute. Visit the working group's repository to participate, view progress, and learn more.
trans-unit.target: We launched a Code of Conduct Working Group to develop an updated structure and set of procedures. Their work is ongoing, and anyone in the community is welcome to participate and contribute. Visit the working group's repository to participate, view progress, and learn more.

trans-unit.source: We also launched an Interim Code of Conduct Committee - composed of both community members and staff-to adjudicate incidents while a more permanent structure is under development by the working group. The Incident Resolution Procedures that the committee is operating under were published earlier this year and finalized after a public comment period.
trans-unit.target: We also launched an Interim Code of Conduct Committee - composed of both community members and staff-to adjudicate incidents while a more permanent structure is under development by the working group. The Incident Resolution Procedures that the committee is operating under were published earlier this year and finalized after a public comment period.

trans-unit.source: KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Valencia was the first time we'd gathered #TeamCloudNative in Europe for three years and the atmosphere felt electric. In fact, we had a lot of firsts in Valencia. Boeing joined us as a platinum member - the first aerospace organization to join CNCF. We hosted Cloud Native Telco Day for the first time, gathering huge players like Deutsche Telekom and Orange who are advancing the industry. Plus, we hosted our first CTO Summit where we discussed how organizations achieve resiliency in multi-cloud strategies.
trans-unit.target: KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Valencia was the first time we'd gathered #TeamCloudNative in Europe for three years and the atmosphere felt electric. In fact, we had a lot of firsts in Valencia. Boeing joined us as a platinum member - the first aerospace organization to join CNCF. We hosted Cloud Native Telco Day for the first time, gathering huge players like Deutsche Telekom and Orange who are advancing the industry. Plus, we hosted our first CTO Summit where we discussed how organizations achieve resiliency in multi-cloud strategies.

trans-unit.source: Showing 18,550 Registered attendees of which 45.2% were men, 6.5% women, 0.4% non-binary/other, and 47.9% preferred not to answer. Of the attendees 7.084 (38%) were in person, 11,466 (62%) were virtual. 65% of visitors were first timers.
trans-unit.target: Showing 18,550 Registered attendees of which 45.2% were men, 6.5% women, 0.4% non-binary/other, and 47.9% preferred not to answer. Of the attendees 7.084 (38%) were in person, 11,466 (62%) were virtual. 65% of visitors were first timers.

trans-unit.source: KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America marked the first time we'd gathered in such big numbers in the Midwest, and Detroit was a wonderful host city. We launched a number of new initiatives, including Security Slam, in partnership with Sonatype. There were also some special surprises at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon, including welcoming our Senior Developer Advocate Ihor Dvoretskyi back in-person, who was granted short-term leave from serving in the Ukraine military.
trans-unit.target: KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America marked the first time we'd gathered in such big numbers in the Midwest, and Detroit was a wonderful host city. We launched a number of new initiatives, including Security Slam, in partnership with Sonatype. There were also some special surprises at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon, including welcoming our Senior Developer Advocate Ihor Dvoretskyi back in-person, who was granted short-term leave from serving in the Ukraine military.

trans-unit.source: CNCF strengthened our commitment to growing the cloud native ecosystem in 2022 - expanding our globally recognized certifications, boosting employment opportunities and helping more folks to upskill their practical application of cloud native technologies.
trans-unit.target: CNCF strengthened our commitment to growing the cloud native ecosystem in 2022 - expanding our globally recognized certifications, boosting employment opportunities and helping more folks to upskill their practical application of cloud native technologies.

trans-unit.source: This year we launched the Prometheus Certified Associate (PCA) - a certification that demonstrates and engineers foundational knowledge of observability and skills using Prometheus, the open source monitoring and alerting toolkit.A new set of credentials were also launched this year: SkillCreds. These allow learners to gain credentials on specific topics related to their experience. Two of the first SkillCreds include Developing Helm Charts (SC104) and Open Data Formats: YAML (SC101). These micro-credentials are short, topic-specific, and cost effective.The importance of training and certifications, and the regard that CNCF courses are held in, was highlighted this year in China where foreign nations are able to apply for visas for Beijing if they earn a CKA certification.
trans-unit.target: This year we launched the Prometheus Certified Associate (PCA) - a certification that demonstrates and engineers foundational knowledge of observability and skills using Prometheus, the open source monitoring and alerting toolkit.A new set of credentials were also launched this year: SkillCreds. These allow learners to gain credentials on specific topics related to their experience. Two of the first SkillCreds include Developing Helm Charts (SC104) and Open Data Formats: YAML (SC101). These micro-credentials are short, topic-specific, and cost effective.The importance of training and certifications, and the regard that CNCF courses are held in, was highlighted this year in China where foreign nations are able to apply for visas for Beijing if they earn a CKA certification.

trans-unit.source: CNCF's training and certification program continued to grow. In 2022, these training courses and exams received considerable interest:
trans-unit.target: CNCF's training and certification program continued to grow. In 2022, these training courses and exams received considerable interest:

trans-unit.target: Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) exam hit 104,000 enrollments

trans-unit.target: Certified Kubernetes Application Developer (CKAD) hit 49,000 exam registrations

trans-unit.target: Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist (CKS) exam hit 18,000 registrations

trans-unit.target: Kubernetes and Cloud Native Associate (KCNA) exam hit 4,000 registrations (since its launch in November 2021)

trans-unit.target: Prometheus Certified Associate (PCA) exam hit 280+ registrations (since its launch on September 8, 2022)

trans-unit.source: Kubernetes Training Partner (KTP) program grew to 57 certified companies
trans-unit.target: Kubernetes Training Partner (KTP) program grew to 57 certified companies

trans-unit.source: Kubernetes Certified Service Provider (KCSP) program grew to 254 companies
trans-unit.target: Kubernetes Certified Service Provider (KCSP) program grew to 254 companies

trans-unit.source: Throughout 2022, CNCF underscored our commitment to making cloud native ubiquitous - hosting 20 graduated projects, 35 incubating and 102 sandbox projects, driven by more than 178,000 contributors representing 189 countries.
trans-unit.target: Throughout 2022, CNCF underscored our commitment to making cloud native ubiquitous - hosting 20 graduated projects, 35 incubating and 102 sandbox projects, driven by more than 178,000 contributors representing 189 countries.

trans-unit.source: The Technical Oversight Committee doubled down on cloud native security in 2022, and approved the formation of a new Technical Advisory Group, TAG Environmental Sustainability focusing on carbon outputs around cloud native computing.
trans-unit.target: The Technical Oversight Committee doubled down on cloud native security in 2022, and approved the formation of a new Technical Advisory Group, TAG Environmental Sustainability focusing on carbon outputs around cloud native computing.

trans-unit.source: Consistently looking into CNCF project's velocity and the top open source projects gives us a very good indication of trends that are resonating with developers and end users. As a result, we can get insight into platforms that will likely be successful:
trans-unit.target: Consistently looking into CNCF project's velocity and the top open source projects gives us a very good indication of trends that are resonating with developers and end users. As a result, we can get insight into platforms that will likely be successful:

trans-unit.source: With the largest contributor base, Kubernetes continues to mature
trans-unit.target: With the largest contributor base, Kubernetes continues to mature

trans-unit.source: OpenTelemetry has become the second highest velocity project in the CNCF ecosystem, increasing its contributor base
trans-unit.target: OpenTelemetry has become the second highest velocity project in the CNCF ecosystem, increasing its contributor base

trans-unit.source: Backstage has seen one of the fastest growth trajectories this year - solving an important pain point around cloud native developer experience
trans-unit.target: Backstage has seen one of the fastest growth trajectories this year - solving an important pain point around cloud native developer experience

trans-unit.source: GitOps remains an important technique in the cloud native ecosystem, where projects like Argo and Flux continue to cultivate large communities
trans-unit.target: GitOps remains an important technique in the cloud native ecosystem, where projects like Argo and Flux continue to cultivate large communities

trans-unit.source: CNCF conducted a number of open source security audits throughout 2022, in strategic partnership with the Open Source Technology Improvement Fund (OSTIF). A number of projects completed security audits, resulting in 132 security fixes and improvements, 45 CVE's fixed, and 51 security tools built. We also announced the inaugural CloudNative SecurityCon, which will launch in 2023, and bring application developers and modern security experts not just propose solutions that incrementally improve what has come before, but to give room to cutting edge projects and advances in modern security approaches. Furthermore, CNCF funded fuzzing audits for a variety of projects that have resulted in hundreds of bugs being found.
trans-unit.target: CNCF conducted a number of open source security audits throughout 2022, in strategic partnership with the Open Source Technology Improvement Fund (OSTIF). A number of projects completed security audits, resulting in 132 security fixes and improvements, 45 CVE's fixed, and 51 security tools built. We also announced the inaugural CloudNative SecurityCon, which will launch in 2023, and bring application developers and modern security experts not just propose solutions that incrementally improve what has come before, but to give room to cutting edge projects and advances in modern security approaches. Furthermore, CNCF funded fuzzing audits for a variety of projects that have resulted in hundreds of bugs being found.

trans-unit.source: The following CNCF projects have completed security audits or associated work
trans-unit.target: The following CNCF projects have completed security audits or associated work

source.g: Includes 5 critical and 10 high severity findings fixed

target.g: Includes 5 critical and 10 high severity findings fixed

source.g: Denial of service, XSS, Path Traversal, Privilege Escalation, RCE

target.g: Denial of service, XSS, Path Traversal, Privilege Escalation, RCE

trans-unit.source: CNCF's footprint in the Telecom domain increased throughout 2022. In May, the Cloud Native Network Function (CNF) Certification Program (beta) was announced to help Communication Service Providers (CSPs) validate how well their vendors' products follow cloud native principles, and to advise vendors on following cloud native best practices. This is supported by CSPs like Vodafone, Deutsche Telekom and DISH Wireless, and guided by best practices from the Cloud Native Network Function (CNF) Working Group and runs certification tests on the CNF Test Suite.
trans-unit.target: CNCF's footprint in the Telecom domain increased throughout 2022. In May, the Cloud Native Network Function (CNF) Certification Program (beta) was announced to help Communication Service Providers (CSPs) validate how well their vendors' products follow cloud native principles, and to advise vendors on following cloud native best practices. This is supported by CSPs like Vodafone, Deutsche Telekom and DISH Wireless, and guided by best practices from the Cloud Native Network Function (CNF) Working Group and runs certification tests on the CNF Test Suite.

source.g: Earned "Certified CNF" status - for a total of 6 products

target.g: Earned "Certified CNF" status - for a total of 6 products

trans-unit.source: Significant progress has been made in 2022 towards the goal of 100% conformance test coverage of the Kubernetes API, managed through APISnoop - a community-driven project spearheaded by long-time CNCF contributor and community leader Hippie Hacker, which tracks the testing and conformance coverage of Kubernetes by analyzing the audit logs created by e2e test runs.
trans-unit.target: Significant progress has been made in 2022 towards the goal of 100% conformance test coverage of the Kubernetes API, managed through APISnoop - a community-driven project spearheaded by long-time CNCF contributor and community leader Hippie Hacker, which tracks the testing and conformance coverage of Kubernetes by analyzing the audit logs created by e2e test runs.

trans-unit.source: At the start of 2022 there were 85 untested endpoints remaining.
trans-unit.target: At the start of 2022 there were 85 untested endpoints remaining.

trans-unit.source: Conformance test was added across the three release: 1.24 - 16 endpoints tested 1.25 - 23 endpoints tested 1.26 - 10 endpoints tested
trans-unit.target: Conformance test was added across the three release: 1.24 - 16 endpoints tested 1.25 - 23 endpoints tested 1.26 - 10 endpoints tested

trans-unit.source: At the same time 26 endpoints have been identified as being ineligible for conformance testing and move to the ineligible endpoints list. By the end of 2022 only 10 endpoints (2.5%) remain untested. We anticipate cleaning up the last technical debt by Kubecon + CloudNativeCon Europe 2023. The automation for CNCF Kubernetes Conformance Certification repo has been updated for an enhanced user experience with improved functionality under the hood. The CNCF-CI bot also gives more detailed explanations of requirements when a submission fails and supporting documentation has also been improved. These changes help to reduce the complexity of reviewing and approving Kubernetes conformance submissions.
trans-unit.target: At the same time 26 endpoints have been identified as being ineligible for conformance testing and move to the ineligible endpoints list. By the end of 2022 only 10 endpoints (2.5%) remain untested. We anticipate cleaning up the last technical debt by Kubecon + CloudNativeCon Europe 2023. The automation for CNCF Kubernetes Conformance Certification repo has been updated for an enhanced user experience with improved functionality under the hood. The CNCF-CI bot also gives more detailed explanations of requirements when a submission fails and supporting documentation has also been improved. These changes help to reduce the complexity of reviewing and approving Kubernetes conformance submissions.

trans-unit.target: Projects increase their maturity level by demonstrating to the TOC that they have attained end user and vendor adoption, established a healthy rate of code commits and codebase changes, and attracted committers from multiple organizations.

trans-unit.source: Phippy & Friends Explain Cloud Native Computing
trans-unit.target: Phippy & Friends Explain Cloud Native Computing

trans-unit.source: From a humble PHP app, Phippy has gone on to help thousands of folx take their first steps to understanding cloud native computing - from containerisation to automation. Today, Phippy and Friends' mission is to demystify cloud native computing and explain complicated concepts in a compelling, engaging and easy-to-understand manner.
trans-unit.target: From a humble PHP app, Phippy has gone on to help thousands of folx take their first steps to understanding cloud native computing - from containerisation to automation. Today, Phippy and Friends' mission is to demystify cloud native computing and explain complicated concepts in a compelling, engaging and easy-to-understand manner.

trans-unit.source: New Phippy characters, Owlina The Owl, donated by Open Policy Agent and Cappy The Turtle
trans-unit.target: New Phippy characters, Owlina The Owl, donated by Open Policy Agent and Cappy The Turtle

trans-unit.source: Phippy and Friends got a 3D makeover
trans-unit.target: Phippy and Friends got a 3D makeover

trans-unit.source: Are you a maintainer on a graduated project?
trans-unit.target: Are you a maintainer on a graduated project?

trans-unit.source: Do you want to help others better understand the concepts of cloud native computing? Donate a character to the Phippy and Friends family.
trans-unit.target: Do you want to help others better understand the concepts of cloud native computing? Donate a character to the Phippy and Friends family.

trans-unit.source: This year CNCF helped launch two documentary films that supported our mission to humanize developers by telling their story of development in this dynamic medium. In January 2022, The Origins of Kubernetes debuted on YouTube. The two part documentary has since garnered a combined 463,000 views and continues to attract viewers from across the world.
trans-unit.target: This year CNCF helped launch two documentary films that supported our mission to humanize developers by telling their story of development in this dynamic medium. In January 2022, The Origins of Kubernetes debuted on YouTube. The two part documentary has since garnered a combined 463,000 views and continues to attract viewers from across the world.

trans-unit.source: Inside Prometheus debuted in October 2022 at Prometheus Day North America as part of KubeCon + CloudNativeCon NA and has so far garnered 59,000 views on YouTube. Both films succeed in giving a voice and face to the forward-looking engineers who tackled adversity and technical challenges in their quest to change the way we work and live today.
trans-unit.target: Inside Prometheus debuted in October 2022 at Prometheus Day North America as part of KubeCon + CloudNativeCon NA and has so far garnered 59,000 views on YouTube. Both films succeed in giving a voice and face to the forward-looking engineers who tackled adversity and technical challenges in their quest to change the way we work and live today.

trans-unit.source: The CNCF community spans the world, across our contributors, members, meetups, and ambassadors.
trans-unit.target: The CNCF community spans the world, across our contributors, members, meetups, and ambassadors.

trans-unit.source: We doubled down on our commitment to #TeamCloudNative in 2022, investing in community-driven initiatives to fuel sustained momentum, expansion, growth and adoption. Importantly, we continued to sharpen focus on our DEI initiatives, ensuring that the ecosystem is a welcoming place where everybody can thrive.
trans-unit.target: We doubled down on our commitment to #TeamCloudNative in 2022, investing in community-driven initiatives to fuel sustained momentum, expansion, growth and adoption. Importantly, we continued to sharpen focus on our DEI initiatives, ensuring that the ecosystem is a welcoming place where everybody can thrive.

trans-unit.source: CNCF continues to support the development of this incredible cloud native community while also striving to ensure that everyone who participates feels welcome regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, race, ethnicity, age, religion, or economic status. To date, we've offered more than 5,000 diversity and need-based scholarships, through the Dan Kohn Scholarship Fund.
trans-unit.target: CNCF continues to support the development of this incredible cloud native community while also striving to ensure that everyone who participates feels welcome regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, race, ethnicity, age, religion, or economic status. To date, we've offered more than 5,000 diversity and need-based scholarships, through the Dan Kohn Scholarship Fund.

trans-unit.source: Now in their sixth year, the CNCF Community Awards highlighted the most active ambassador and top contributor across all CNCF projects. The awards included:
trans-unit.target: Now in their sixth year, the CNCF Community Awards highlighted the most active ambassador and top contributor across all CNCF projects. The awards included:

trans-unit.source: An individual with incredible technical skills and notable technical achievements in one or multiple CNCF projects
trans-unit.target: An individual with incredible technical skills and notable technical achievements in one or multiple CNCF projects

trans-unit.source: This award recognizes excellence in documentation contributions to CNCF and its projects
trans-unit.target: This award recognizes excellence in documentation contributions to CNCF and its projects

trans-unit.source: To recognize contributors who spend countless hours completing often mundane tasks, CNCF created the “Chop Wood and Carry Water” awards. CNCF was proud to acknowledge the amazing efforts of five individuals for their outstanding contributions in 2022:
trans-unit.target: To recognize contributors who spend countless hours completing often mundane tasks, CNCF created the “Chop Wood and Carry Water” awards. CNCF was proud to acknowledge the amazing efforts of five individuals for their outstanding contributions in 2022:

trans-unit.source: 2022 saw the cloud native community switch from the Meetup platform to Cloud Native Community Groups and the new platform has taken off. It has become the singular place where meetups, online programs, project office hours, and community events are run. The platform now hosts over 31,500 unique chapter members and we are excited to see this platform continue to grow.
trans-unit.target: 2022 saw the cloud native community switch from the Meetup platform to Cloud Native Community Groups and the new platform has taken off. It has become the singular place where meetups, online programs, project office hours, and community events are run. The platform now hosts over 31,500 unique chapter members and we are excited to see this platform continue to grow.

trans-unit.source: CNCF worked closely in partnership with individual contributors and community groups throughout 2022, developing programs to navigate and manage the fast-growing ecosystem - rising to meet the growing global demand for cloud native technologies.
trans-unit.target: CNCF worked closely in partnership with individual contributors and community groups throughout 2022, developing programs to navigate and manage the fast-growing ecosystem - rising to meet the growing global demand for cloud native technologies.

trans-unit.source: The CNCF Transportation User Group's purpose is to function as a focal meeting point for the discussion and advancement of cloud native in transportation and logistics organizations. This includes enumerating current practices, identifying gaps, and directing efforts to help improve workflows.
trans-unit.target: The CNCF Transportation User Group's purpose is to function as a focal meeting point for the discussion and advancement of cloud native in transportation and logistics organizations. This includes enumerating current practices, identifying gaps, and directing efforts to help improve workflows.

trans-unit.source: The Cloud Native Glossary is a project led by the CNCF Business Value Subcommittee. Its goal is to explain cloud native concepts in clear and simple language without requiring any previous technical knowledge.
trans-unit.target: The Cloud Native Glossary is a project led by the CNCF Business Value Subcommittee. Its goal is to explain cloud native concepts in clear and simple language without requiring any previous technical knowledge.

trans-unit.source: Seven new translations of the CNCF Glossary were donated this year
trans-unit.target: Seven new translations of the CNCF Glossary were donated this year

trans-unit.source: Seven new translations of the CNCF Glossary were donated this year
trans-unit.target: Seven new translations of the CNCF Glossary were donated this year

trans-unit.source: The Glossary is a community-driven effort and everyone is welcome to contribute new terms, update current ones, or help translate into different languages.
trans-unit.target: The Glossary is a community-driven effort and everyone is welcome to contribute new terms, update current ones, or help translate into different languages.

trans-unit.source: CNCF proudly supported more than 100 individuals through various mentoring and internship opportunities in 2022, including the LFX mentorship platform, Google Summer of Code (GSoC), Google Summer of Docs (GSoD) program, and Outreachy. These programs are important catalysts for internships to have an impact on future technologies that we all depend on. In August, the TAG Contributor Strategy approved a Mentoring Working Group. The primary goals of this Working Group are to have the community administer CNCF mentorship initiatives and, by doing so, to help provide the capacity needed to grow and add new mentorship programs.
trans-unit.target: CNCF proudly supported more than 100 individuals through various mentoring and internship opportunities in 2022, including the LFX mentorship platform, Google Summer of Code (GSoC), Google Summer of Docs (GSoD) program, and Outreachy. These programs are important catalysts for internships to have an impact on future technologies that we all depend on. In August, the TAG Contributor Strategy approved a Mentoring Working Group. The primary goals of this Working Group are to have the community administer CNCF mentorship initiatives and, by doing so, to help provide the capacity needed to grow and add new mentorship programs.

trans-unit.source: We sponsored 106 students to work on 28 CNCF Projects
trans-unit.target: We sponsored 106 students to work on 28 CNCF Projects

trans-unit.source: Internally, we employ 41 people from various backgrounds and locations; 61% women, 39% men. CNCF's Governance Leadership, comprising the Governing Board and Technical Oversight Committee, is 20% women and 80% men.
trans-unit.target: Internally, we employ 41 people from various backgrounds and locations; 61% women, 39% men. CNCF's Governance Leadership, comprising the Governing Board and Technical Oversight Committee, is 20% women and 80% men.

trans-unit.source: CNCF's revenue is derived from four primary fundraising sources, including membership, event sponsorship, event registration, and training.
trans-unit.target: CNCF's revenue is derived from four primary fundraising sources, including membership, event sponsorship, event registration, and training.

trans-unit.source: 27.9% from event registration, 38% from event sponorship
trans-unit.target: 27.9% from event registration, 38% from event sponorship

trans-unit.source: 6.6% for Marketing, Comms and Busiess Development
trans-unit.target: 6.6% for Marketing, Comms and Busiess Development

trans-unit.source: A basic premise behind CNCF, our conferences (including KubeCon + CloudNativeCon), and open source, in general, is that interactions are positive-sum. There is no fixed amount of investment, mindshare, or development contribution allocated to specific projects. Equally important, a neutral home for a project and community fosters this type of positive-sum thinking and drives the growth and diversity that we believe are core elements of a successful open source project.
trans-unit.target: A basic premise behind CNCF, our conferences (including KubeCon + CloudNativeCon), and open source, in general, is that interactions are positive-sum. There is no fixed amount of investment, mindshare, or development contribution allocated to specific projects. Equally important, a neutral home for a project and community fosters this type of positive-sum thinking and drives the growth and diversity that we believe are core elements of a successful open source project.

trans-unit.source: We hope you enjoyed reflecting on all the great things we accomplished together in 2022.
trans-unit.target: We hope you enjoyed reflecting on all the great things we accomplished together in 2022.

trans-unit.source: Your comments and feedback are welcome at info@cncf.io
trans-unit.target: Your comments and feedback are welcome at info@cncf.io
